speaker: ROSALIND
text: Never talk to me. I will weep.

speaker: CELIA
text: Do, I prithee, but yet have the grace to consider

speaker: CELIA
text: that tears do not become a man.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: But have I not cause to weep?

speaker: CELIA
text: As good cause as one would desire. Therefore

speaker: CELIA
text: weep.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: His very hair is of the dissembling color.

speaker: CELIA
text: Something browner than Judas’s. Marry, his

speaker: CELIA
text: kisses are Judas’s own children.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: I’ faith, his hair is of a good color.

speaker: CELIA
text: An excellent color. Your chestnut was ever the

speaker: CELIA
text: only color.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: And his kissing is as full of sanctity as the

speaker: ROSALIND
text: touch of holy bread.

speaker: CELIA
text: He hath bought a pair of cast lips of Diana. A

speaker: CELIA
text: nun of winter’s sisterhood kisses not more religiously.

speaker: CELIA
text: The very ice of chastity is in them.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: But why did he swear he would come this

speaker: ROSALIND
text: morning, and comes not?

speaker: CELIA
text: Nay, certainly, there is no truth in him.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Do you think so?

speaker: CELIA
text: Yes, I think he is not a pickpurse nor a horse-stealer,

speaker: CELIA
text: but for his verity in love, I do think him as

speaker: CELIA
text: concave as a covered goblet or a worm-eaten nut.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Not true in love?

speaker: CELIA
text: Yes, when he is in, but I think he is not in.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: You have heard him swear downright he

speaker: ROSALIND
text: was.

speaker: CELIA
text: “Was” is not “is.” Besides, the oath of a lover is

speaker: CELIA
text: no stronger than the word of a tapster. They are

speaker: CELIA
text: both the confirmer of false reckonings. He attends

speaker: CELIA
text: here in the forest on the Duke your father.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: I met the Duke yesterday and had much

speaker: ROSALIND
text: question with him. He asked me of what parentage

speaker: ROSALIND
text: I was. I told him, of as good as he. So he laughed

speaker: ROSALIND
text: and let me go. But what talk we of fathers when

speaker: ROSALIND
text: there is such a man as Orlando?

speaker: CELIA
text: O, that’s a brave man. He writes brave verses,

speaker: CELIA
text: speaks brave words, swears brave oaths, and breaks

speaker: CELIA
text: them bravely, quite traverse, athwart the heart of

speaker: CELIA
text: his lover, as a puny tilter that spurs his horse but on

speaker: CELIA
text: one side breaks his staff like a noble goose; but all’s

speaker: CELIA
text: brave that youth mounts and folly guides.

speaker: CELIA
text: Who comes here?

speaker: CORIN
text:
Mistress
               
              and
               
              master
              ,
               
              you
               
              have
               
              oft
               
              inquired

speaker: CORIN
text:
After
               
              the
               
              shepherd
               
              that
               
              complained
               
              of
               
              love
              ,

speaker: CORIN
text:
Who
               
              you
               
              saw
               
              sitting
               
              by
               
              me
               
              on
               
              the
               
              turf
              ,

speaker: CORIN
text:
Praising
               
              the
               
              proud
               
              disdainful
               
              shepherdess

speaker: CORIN
text:
That
               
              was
               
              his
               
              mistress
              .

speaker: CELIA
text:
Well
              ,
               
              and
               
              what
               
              of
               
              him
              ?

speaker: CORIN
text:
If
               
              you
               
              will
               
              see
               
              a
               
              pageant
               
              truly
               
              played

speaker: CORIN
text:
Between
               
              the
               
              pale
               
              complexion
               
              of
               
              true
               
              love

speaker: CORIN
text:
And
               
              the
               
              red
               
              glow
               
              of
               
              scorn
               
              and
               
              proud
               
              disdain
              ,

speaker: CORIN
text:
Go
               
              hence
               
              a
               
              little
              ,
               
              and
               
              I
               
              shall
               
              conduct
               
              you

speaker: CORIN
text:
If
               
              you
               
              will
               
              mark
               
              it
              .

speaker: ROSALIND
text:
O
               
              come
              ,
               
              let
               
              us
               
              remove
              .

speaker: ROSALIND
text:
The
               
              sight
               
              of
               
              lovers
               
              feedeth
               
              those
               
              in
               
              love
              .

speaker: ROSALIND
text:
As
                   
                  Ganymede
                  ,
                
                 
                
                  to
                   
                  Corin
                  .
                
                 
              
              Bring
               
              us
               
              to
               
              this
               
              sight
              ,

speaker: ROSALIND
text:
I’ll
               
              prove
               
              a
